text.p: - Government proposes new five percent ecological tax on purchases of new cars.
- Foreign Minister Zoran Thaler visited Belgian Foreign Minister Erick Derycke who said Slovenia fulfilled conditions needed to enter EU or NATO, but refused to talk about specific candidates.

- The Christian Democratic Party said it will hold a congress in June. The congress should implement changes that improve the party's position after the November general election when the number of its seats fell to 10 from 15.
- Trade unions said talks with employers on labour benefits have been unsuccessful so far and that it will be difficult to reach an agreement before the end of May.
- Police found the suspect who threw away 16 barrels of highly poisonous waste last week.
- About 25 Slovenian companies and institutes and five inventors are taking part in an international industrial fair in Hannover this week.
- President Milan Kucan was briefed by the supreme command of Slovenia's army on its current activities and future strategy.
- Slovenia's only nuclear power plant Krsko in March reached its full capacity and produced 468,164 megaWatt hours of electrical power.
